poem:
The Archives of Orwell

tucked in brown envelopes,
the whispers of a pen:
letters, shadows
creasing paper,
a publisher's breath,
these are the bones of thought,
fragile as the truth,
a museum fading,
in rooms without light,
a clock ticked away the words,
once loud as sirens,
now drowned in the soft
dust of neglect.
